headline: Ameren Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Ameren (NYSE:AEE) management highlighted strong 2025 financial performance, an expanded capital plan, and new large-load agreements in Missouri during the company’s fourth quarter 2025 earnings call. Executives also reiterated 2026 earnings guidance and introduced a new long-term earnings growth out

headline: Ameren (AEE) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Martin J. Lyons: Beginning on page four, here we highlight some of the key updates we will cover today.  Specifically, we delivered 2025 adjusted earnings of $5.03 per share which represents 8.6% growth over adjusted 2024 results.  Martin J. Lyons: not only of the strong operational and financial results we delivered as an Ameren Corporation team, but also our strategic plans and accomplishments that we expect will lead to competitive long-term returns for our shareholders in the years ahead.

headline: Ameren Q4 Earnings Higher Than Expected, Revenues Decline Y/Y
summary: AEE's Q4 EPS beats estimates, revenues drop 8.2%, and higher operating income and rising sales volumes lift full-year earnings 8.6%.

headline: Entergy's Q4 Earnings In Line With Estimates, Revenues Rise Y/Y
summary: ETR's Q4 EPS matches estimates but falls 22.7% year over year, even as revenues climb 8% and 2026 earnings guidance comes in above consensus.

headline: Ameren Missouri is building a stronger grid and delivering reliability for customers
summary: Ameren Missouri, a subsidiary of Ameren Corporation (NYSE: AEE), has filed its updated Smart Energy Plan with the Missouri Public Service Commission. The filing highlights how Missourians are benefiting from the company's investments in customer reliability and outlines a five-year strategy to advance a stronger, more resilient electric grid. In 2025, upgrades deployed through the Smart Energy Plan automatically prevented 160,000 customer outages during major storms.

headline: 300-MW Ameren fast-track project hits snag on DOE transmission funding uncertainty
summary: It’s unclear if the U.S. Department of Energy will help fund a set of 345-kV projects in the Great Plains region, leaving Ameren Missouri in doubt about potential interconnection costs for its project.

raw.headline: 300-MW Ameren fast-track project hits snag on DOE transmission funding uncertainty

headline: Why The Ameren (AEE) Story Is Shifting Toward Long Term Fundamentals
summary: The latest Ameren price target update reflects a shift in how analysts are framing the story around the stock, even though specific target figures were not disclosed. With the narrative being refreshed, this change in target is tied less to short term noise and more to an updated view of what could matter most to Ameren over the long run. Read on to see what is driving this new angle on the stock and how you can keep on top of future narrative changes as they emerge. Stay updated as the Fair...
